column1: Art Institute of Chicago////First of all
column2: I highly recommend renting the audio tour. There is so much more information the narrative provides over the printed descriptions
column3: the audio will give you a much deeper and lasting appreciation of the art. It allows you to Â focus on specific elements of the piece at the same time the narrator is describing it. At the end of some descriptions
column4: it may give you the option of hearing even more details of the artwork
column5: or sometimes will direct you to another nearby piece to compare.
